briefTitle: Screening for HPV and Cervical Cancer in Young Women With Perinatally Acquired HIV
officialTitle: Screening for Human Papillomavirus and Cervical Cancer in Young Women With Perinatally Acquired HIV

protocolDocument.label: Study Protocol and Statistical Analysis Plan

eligibilityCriteria.criteria:
Inclusion Criteria - Cohort 1:

* Perinatally acquired HIV aged 18+
* Sexually active
* Able to give informed consent

Inclusion Criteria - Cohort 2:

* Perinatally acquired HIV aged 18+
* Able to give informed consent

Exclusion Criteria - Cohort 1:

* Pregnancy
* Not sexually active
* Previous total abdominal hysterectomy
* Unable to give informed consent

Exclusion Criteria - Cohort 2:

* Unable to give informed consent

primary.description: Cervical sample taken in the clinic setting and sent to the laboratory for cytological examination. Prevalence of abnormal cytology is reported as the number of samples that had a non-normal cytology result (e.g. dyskaryotic cells) out of the total number tested

secondary.measure: Prevalence of High Risk HPV by Subtype
secondary.description: Cervical sample taken in the clinic setting and tested for high-risk HPV on site using the Cepheid GeneXpert. Prevalence reported as the number of samples that were positive for any high-risk HPV out of all those tested
Participants with abnormal cytology and/or tested positive for high-risk HPV were referred for colposcopy. Prevalence reported as the number of participants who were diagnosed with CIN2+
Number of participants testing positive for HPV 16 and 18 antibodies out of the those tested
